intro: Cyclantheropsis occidentalis, commonly known as the western globe cactus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a globular stem covered in spines, which helps reduce water loss and deter herbivores. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Cyclantheropsis occidentalis is adapted to withstand extreme heat and drought, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
